DOC.brief_summary: The purpose research study determine application ice , control group , muscle stimulation program CompexÂ® series help reduce eliminate delayed muscle soreness perform leg extension flexion . Individuals complete health history questionnaire determine qualify study . We measure leg girth measure tape take pain measurement hamstring use spring press leg . Individuals warm-up bike without resistance 5 minute follow 10 regular leg extension flexion exercise . Individuals perform 6 set 10 leg extension flexion exercise biodex machine ( similar leg curl machine gym ) . Individuals perform set maximum effort capables . After set 10 individual 2 minute rest . We ask rank leg soreness scale 1-10 . Individuals assign modality either ice , control group compex . Individuals perform modality ( ice , control , compex ) assign longer sore . Over next five day individual return measure level soreness , leg girth pain pressure . This study examine follow hypothesis : H1 : There difference pressure pain threshold use Compex compare group . H2 : There difference perceive soreness use Compex compare group . H3 : There difference muscular strength use Compex compare group . H4 : There difference active range motion use Compex compare group .
DOC.brief_title: Compex Use With Delayed Onset Muscle Soreness : A Comparison Other Methods
DOC.criteria: The studied population compose 45 physically active college student age 1830 year old . Inclusionary criterion participation physical activity define ACSM , mixture moderate ( i.e. , sufficient raise heart rate begin sweat ) vigorous ( i.e. , breathe hard fast rapidly rise heart rate ) intensity aerobic activity muscle strengthening ( i.e. , weight lift point anther repetition complete without help ) activity two time per week ( ACSM , 2011 . ) Exclusionary criterion surgery within last six month require immobilization four week , discomfort perform intense physical activity , disease like muscular dystrophy predispose muscular damage beyond reasonable level result physical activity , current injury knee hip .
